question.title: Pixel Watch 3(Wear OS by Google). Is there way how to disable crown button programmatically?
question.body:
I am developing an app using Google's Pixel Watch 3 (Wear OS by Google 5.0). I am looking for a solution to the problem of accidentally pressing the crown and being taken to the home screen(watch face).

If not possible, is there a way to launch the app again and return to the app screen immediately after returning to the home screen?

I tried the following document, but it did not solve the problem. (https://developer.android.com/training/wearables/user-input/physical-buttons?hl=ja)

thank you.

answers.body:
Due to the security restrictions and user experience guidelines in the Android and Wear OS platforms, applications can not programmatically disable or update/modify the functionality of the hardware button (crown button) in Wear OS devices including Pixel watch 3.

The control of hardware is managed at the system level, similar to how the back and home buttons work in Android mobiles.

question_comments.body: @ianhanniballake It's not an Ongoing Activity, but it is constantly communicating with a Windows program via TCP, and the "keepScreenOn" property in the layout.xml set for the Activity is TRUE. I'm sorry if my answer is off the mark.

Is the app you are writing an ongoing activity? Those already offer users a way to quickly get back into your activity, rather than trying to disable an important system gesture (which you cannot do anyways).

79559260.body: Thank you everyone for your replies. I also appreciate you providing the sources. I think the security restrictions are reasonable. I hope this helps anyone in the same situation.

There is not a single document which tells everything, I am providing some links so that you can go through into it. 1. Phusical button : developer.android.com/training/wearables/user-input/… . 2. Security checklist : developer.android.com/privacy-and-security/security-tips . 3. KeyEvent : developer.android.com/reference/android/view/KeyEvent . (Optional) Discussion : reddit.com/r/WearOS/?rdt=61998

From the linked page. "Wear OS 3.0 reserves two buttons for the OS, while Wear OS 2.0 reserves only one. This reduces the number of buttons you can assign actions to."  In practice this means that most Wear 3 devices only have OS controlled buttons

Thank you for your reply. Could you please tell me where I can find the documentation for security restrictions and user experience guidelines? I looked at the following but couldn't find anything relevant. ・developer.android.com ・support.google.com
